intro: Brachycorythis ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda short-leafed tree, is a tropical tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Its bark is thick and corky, providing some resistance to pests and diseases. The species is of interest for its potential ecological role and ornamental value in horticulture.
